get.description: Get the list of contracts that a user has access to.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Contract API

200.description: The response provides a list of contracts.

errors.detail: From date must be within 15 months in past from the current date

parameters.description: __Enum__ Returns a specific set of contracts. Select `TOP` to return only parent contracts, or `ALL` to return both parent and child contracts.
parameters.name: depth

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

get.description: Get the IDs and names of the products associated with a contract for the time frame selected.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Contract API

200.description: The response provides a list of products.

products.description: Object that lists the products associated with the contract specified.

contractId.description: The unique identifier for a contract.

marketing-products.description: The identifiers and names for each product included on a contract.

marketingProductId.description: The unique identifier for a product.

marketingProductName.description: The formal name of a product.

errors.detail: From date must be within 15 months in past from the current date
errors.title: from

errors.detail: To date must be on or before the current date
errors.title: to

instance.description: The URL for this error occurrence.

requestTime.description: Request date expressed as an ISO 8601 timestamp.

instance.description: The URL for this error occurrence.

requestTime.description: Request date expressed as an ISO 8601 timestamp.

parameters.description: The start date, in UTC, to use when looking for products associated with a contract. The search always begins at midnight (0:00) UTC of the specified date.  The default start date is 30 days prior to the current date.  For current contracts, you can select a date within the past 15 months of the current date. For expired contracts, you are limited to a date range of 30 days within the 15 month window.
parameters.name: from

parameters.description: The end date, in UTC, to use when looking for products associated with a contract. The search always ends at 23:59:59 UTC of the specified date.  The default end date is the current date.
parameters.name: to

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). parameters.description: The unique identifier for a contract.

get.description: Get the IDs of the Content Provider (CP) reporting groups that you have access to along with their names. To run this operation, your user account needs the CPCode Rep Group role. To add this role, use the [Identity and Access Management application](https://control.akamai.com/admin/?tab=CONFIGURE&type=context).

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Contract API

200.description: The response provides a list of reporting groups.

schema.description: A logical grouping of content provider (CP) codes.

id.description: Unique identifier for each reporting group.

name.description: The descriptive name you supply for each reporting group.

get.description: Get the IDs and names of the products associated with the reporting group for the time frame selected. To run this operation, your user account needs the CPCode Rep Group role. To add this role, use the [Identity and Access Management application](https://control.akamai.com/admin/?tab=CONFIGURE&type=context). When a request is successful, it may return either a 200 or a 300 response. The API returns a 200 (OK) response when the CP code reporting group is associated with only one contract. You'll receive a `300 Multiple Choices` response when the request returns a list of matching contracts because the CP code reporting group is associated with multiple contracts. To retrieve product information when you receive a 300 response code, make a new GET request to the hyperlinks provided in the response.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Contract API

200.description: The response provides a list of products. This response is returned when the CP code reporting group is associated with only one contract.

products.description: Object that lists the products associated with the contract specified.

contractId.description: The unique identifier for a contract.

marketing-products.description: The identifiers and names for each product included on a contract.

marketingProductId.description: The unique identifier for a product.

marketingProductName.description: The formal name of a product.

300.description: The request returned a list of matching contracts because the CP code reporting group is associated with multiple contracts. To retrieve product information, make a new GET request to a specific contract ID using the API listed in the response.

contracts.description: Array of contracts that the requesting user has access to.

contractId.description: The unique identifier for a contract.

href.description: The URL that accesses product information for the `contractId`.

The default start date is 30 days prior to the current date.  For current contracts, you can select a date within the past 15 months of the current date. For expired contracts, you are limited to a date range of 30 days within the 15 month window.
